summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit for August 9, 2019. The sheets record staff checks on inmates in continuous lockdown status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, requiring observation at least twice per hour. The logs are reviewed by a Lieutenant and Captain.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The Lieutenant is listed as the reviewing officer for the morning watch on the inmate observation check sheets.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: The Captain is listed as the reviewing officer for the inmate observation check sheets.

events.title: Inmate Observation Rounds
events.description: Staff members at MCC New York Special Housing Unit conducted 30-minute observation rounds on inmates in continuous locked down status throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit dated August 9, 2019.
The logs detail 30-minute observation checks on inmates held in continuous lockdown status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation.
The procedure required staff to observe each inmate at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule, with checks no more than 40 minutes apart.
Each sheet was reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
